docs.lead_paragraph: Germany's energy exchange, part of Deutsche Boerse AG, has agreed to buy all the shares in U.S. peer Nodal to pursue its global growth strategy, Deutsche Boerse said on Friday.

headline.print_headline: Deutsche Boerse's EEX Says Takes Over U.S. Peer Nodal

docs.lead_paragraph: No. 5 South Carolina needed a big effort to open the Southeastern Conference Tournament, with all-SEC forward Alaina Coates sidelined again because of an ankle injury. The top-seeded Gamecocks leaned on A'ja Wilson.

headline.print_headline: Wilson Leads No. 5 South Carolina Past Georgia 72-48

docs.lead_paragraph: President Donald Trump, his administration under siege for contacts with Russian officials, is calling for "an immediate investigation" into Senate Minority Leader Charles Schumer's own ties to Russian President Vladimir Putin.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nationalist Serbian lawmakers booed the European Union's top diplomat Federica Mogherini on Friday as she addressed their parliament during tour aimed at addressing concerns about rising tensions in the Balkans.

docs.lead_paragraph: French far-right leader Marine Le Pen refused to attend a summons by judges over allegations of misuse of European Union funds, her lawyer told Reuters on Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Jewish community centers, schools and cemeteries have been dealing with waves of bomb threats and vandalism this year. Most of these crimes remain unsolved, though a man in St. Louis was charged Friday with eight of the threats made against Jewish institutions as well as a bomb threat to New York's Anti-Defamation League.

headline.print_headline: A Look at the Threats, Vandalism Against Jewish Institutions
headline.main: A Look at the Threats, Vandalism Against Jewish Institutions
